document_data.name: ''Cowl of Warding''
document_data.mainbody: '''''Cowls of warding''''' were types of [[enchanted]] headwear created by the [[cleric]]s of [[Mask]] and used by the [[Shadow Thieves]] of [[Amn]].
document_data.Description: ''Cowls of warding'' were made out of thick black cloth that covered the wearer's entire face, leaving only a slit exposing their eyes.
document_data.Powers: ''Cowls of warding'' were enchanted to shield the wearer from mind-affecting spells and rendered them unrestrained as if under the effects of the ''[[freedom]]'' spell.
document_data.History: These pieces of protective headgear were originally created by the clergy of Mask, the god of thieves. Closer to the 14{{th}} century [[DR]], similar items were commissioned by Amnian Shadow Thieves. By the late 14{{th}} century DR, these cowls could be found in several places across the [[Sword Coast]]
